intro: Dendrobenthamia japonica var. huaxiensis, commonly known as the Huaxi orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte on trees or rocks, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), and it produces small, greenish-white flowers with a distinct fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
